content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) (serving as the factory interface)
– Dedicated Burner Inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Connected Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (listed as a neighbour)
– Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) (receiving items via belt connection)

### Depot Belt System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden Chest placed as the belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Transport Belt Segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Dedicated Depot Burner Inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP with a pickup position at (3.5, y=15.5) and a drop position at (3.5, y=13.5)

ERROR TIPS

• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
 – Do not attempt to connect transport belts directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine target. Always introduce an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine so that the belt connection targets a compatible inserter instead.

• Entity Placement Distance Error  
 – Verify that target positions are within the allowable placement range. If a target position is too far (for example, a chest placement error occurred when the distance exceeded the maximum), move closer before attempting placement.

• Inventory Shortage Error  
 – Confirm that the required item is present in the inventory before attempting placement. An error occurred when a wooden chest was not available for placement.

• Undefined Variable Error  
 – Check and use the correct variable names when referencing target entities. An undefined variable (target_chest) was encountered instead of one of the defined names such as target_pos or depot_chest.
